body.p: In developing the Phase 2 amendments, the Board was aware that considerations similar to those discussed in paragraphs BC342–BC345 apply to designating an alternative benchmark rate as a non-contractually specified risk portion in either a cash flow hedge or a fair value hedge. This is because an entity’s ability to conclude that the alternative benchmark rate meets the requirements in paragraphs 81 and AG99F of IAS 39 that a risk portion must be separately identifiable and reliably measurable could be affected in the early stages of the reform.
